intro: Peucedanum mashanense, commonly known as Chinese cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in umbels. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas. The seeds are small and contain compounds that have been studied for their potential medicinal properties.
